questions.question: Docs‑as‑Code emphasizes:
options: Versioned docs reviewed via PRs and validated by CI
questions.additionalContext: Treat docs like code: versioning, reviews, and CI validation improve quality and freshness.

questions.question: Templates help by:
questions.additionalContext: ADRs, runbooks, and README templates ensure consistent structure and content.

questions.question: Information architecture practice:
options: Unclear ownership and nested folders without logic
Clear ownership and discoverability per system or domain
questions.additionalContext: Link code to docs (services → READMEs, APIs → OpenAPI, ops → runbooks) with clear owners.

questions.question: Governance that prevents drift:
options: Ongoing review cadence and freshness SLAs
questions.additionalContext: Set owners and review cadence to keep documentation current and trustworthy.

questions.question: Metric that indicates documentation health:
options: Lines of code in the repo
questions.additionalContext: Track freshness, coverage, and search success/time‑to‑find to improve outcomes.

questions.question: Linking code to docs example:
questions.additionalContext: Make APIs discoverable through OpenAPI; operational knowledge through runbooks; services through READMEs.

questions.question: Policy/style linting in CI helps by:
options: Automating checks for required sections and style
questions.additionalContext: Linting detects missing sections and style drift early, improving quality.

questions.question: Outcome of robust documentation standards:
options: Reduced handoff errors and faster onboarding
questions.additionalContext: Standards reduce handoff errors, unblock incidents, and improve compliance readiness.

questions.question: Propose a “docs‑as‑code” rollout for a monorepo: templates, ownership, CI checks, and review cadence. How will you measure improvement?
questions.sampleStrongResponse: Introduce README, runbook, and ADR templates with owners per service. Add CI linting for required sections and stale checks. Establish quarterly freshness reviews. Measure doc freshness, coverage across systems, search success rate, and mean time‑to‑find critical docs.

questions.question: An audit is upcoming. Outline a lightweight plan to achieve compliance readiness by default through documentation standards and automation.
questions.sampleStrongResponse: Define ownership and SLAs, enforce templates, and add CI checks for required content. Link code to OpenAPI and runbooks, auto‑summarize incidents/PRs into docs, and monitor coverage/freshness dashboards. Success is smoother audits and reduced time‑to‑find during incidents.
